Ctrl
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  Ctrl.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
HDRSolverUpdateListener
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements HDRSolverUpdateListener

Controller of the application. It generates a view and starts the calculation of an HDR-Image.

Access to the controller is available via the singelton pattern.

Author:
sebastianzillessen

calculate

public java.lang.Float calculate(java.lang.String s)
calculates the exposure time of a string (1/5 will result to 0.2)

Parameters:
s - string to be parsed
Returns:
Exposure time if detectable, otherwise null

errorOccured

public void errorOccured(java.lang.String message,
                         HDRResult lastResult)
this method is going to be called if some errors occured in the solver. If available the last calculated result will be returned.

Specified by:
errorOccured in interface HDRSolverUpdateListener
Parameters:
message - Error message
lastResult - last result if one is available (null otherwise)

extractExposureTime

read exposure time first by trying to extract it from metadata, then by reading the filename.

Parameters:
f - file name to read
Returns:
Exposure time if detectable, otherwise null

readImages

public void readImages(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float> imgList,
                       boolean saltAndPepperNoise,
                       double gaussianNoise)
Reads a list of images from a set if filenames and exposure times. It adds noise if desired. Old images get deleted and are not preserved.

Parameters:
imgList - map of filename and exposure time. Each entry is a image.
saltAndPepperNoise - adds salt and pepper noise if true
gaussianNoise - add gaussian with a standard derivation of this value (0 is no noise)
Throws:

solve

public void solve(double lambda,
                  int iterations,
                  double mu,
                  boolean robustnessDataG,
                  boolean robustnessSmoothnessE,
                  WeightMode weight,
                  double alpha)
Method to start the generation of an HDR Image. Is called by the UI and updates the UI asynchron.

Parameters:
lambda - weight factor for the smoothness term
iterations - number of iterations for the inner and outer iterations of the solver
mu - weight factor for the monotonie constraint
robustnessDataG - true: subquadratic penalty functions are used in the calculation of the response curve
robustnessSmoothnessE - true: subquadratic penalty functions are used for the 2d smoothness term of the resulting HDR image
weight - weightning mode which should be used to weight the greyvalues during the complete calculations
alpha - weight factor of the 2d smoothness term of the resulting irradiance map

updateState

public void updateState(int progress,
                        HDRResult hdrResult)
Description copied from interface: HDRSolverUpdateListener
method is called from the IHDRSolver whenever a new temp. result is available or when the process is finished.

Specified by:
updateState in interface HDRSolverUpdateListener
Parameters:
progress - progress in percent. 100% = finished
hdrResult - temporary (or final) HDR result.
